summary: "House, M.D." was an American medical drama TV show that aired on Fox from 2004 to 2012. It starred Hugh Laurie as Dr. Gregory House, a brilliant but unconventional doctor who leads a team at a fictional New Jersey hospital. Despite his pain medication dependence, House's unique insights help him solve complex medical cases. The series had several cast changes over eight seasons, with House's diagnostic team evolving. The show was very popular, winning many awards and being distributed worldwide. It ended after its eighth season.
title: House (TV series)
